Aurora.Modules.Archivers.OspResolver Class Reference

Resolves OpenSim Profile Anchors (OSPA). An OSPA is a string used to provide information for identifying user profiles or supplying a simple name if no profile is available. More...

static UUID ResolveOspaName (string name, IUserAccountService userService)
 Resolve an OSPI name by querying existing persistent user profiles. If there is no persistent user profile then a temporary user profile is inserted in the cache.

Detailed Description

Resolves OpenSim Profile Anchors (OSPA). An OSPA is a string used to provide information for identifying user profiles or supplying a simple name if no profile is available.

static UUID Aurora.Modules.Archivers.OspResolver.ResolveOspa ( string  ospa,
IUserAccountService  userService 
) [static]

Resolve an osp string into the most suitable internal OpenSim identifier.

In some cases this will be a UUID if a suitable profile exists on the system. In other cases, this may just return the same identifier after creating a temporary profile.

Parameters:
ospa 
commsManager 
Returns:
A suitable UUID for use in Second Life client communication. If the string was not a valid ospa, then UUID.Zero is returned.
static UUID Aurora.Modules.Archivers.OspResolver.ResolveOspaName ( string  name,
IUserAccountService  userService 
) [static, protected]

Resolve an OSPI name by querying existing persistent user profiles. If there is no persistent user profile then a temporary user profile is inserted in the cache.

Parameters:
name 
commsManager 
Returns:
An OpenSim internal identifier for the name given. Returns null if the name was not valid
